intro: Arthraxon maopingensis, commonly known as the Maoping sedge, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or wetlands. Arthraxon maopingensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
